questions.question: The teacher handed ..................... the question booklets to the students.
questions.description: To hand out is to distribute.

questions.question: When the merchant got old, he handed ....................... his business to his son.
questions.description: To hand something over is to give up control or possession of something.

questions.question: That is my pen. Hand it .......................
questions.description: To hand something back is to return it.

questions.question: My grandmother has promised that she will hand her precious jewels .................. to me.
questions.description: To hand something down is to pass it on to the next generation.

questions.question: My teacher was surprised when I handed .................. my assignment on time.
questions.description: To hand assignment in is to submit it for evaluation.

questions.question: Before I can leave my job, I have to hand ...................... my resignation at least two weeks in advance.
questions.description: To hand something in is to give it for review.

questions.question: The teacher will hand ....................... all the answer sheets tomorrow.
questions.description: To hand something back is to return it.

questions.question: The house that I live in was handed ...................... from my grandfather to my father.
questions.description: To hand something down is to pass it from one person to another person.

questions.question: The boys are handing .................... flyers for the show.
questions.description: To hand out is to distribute.

questions.question: I don't like to talk to Alice. She is quite fond of handing .................... unwanted advise.
questions.description: To hand out something is to give it.

questions.question: I am saving money because I must have something to hand .................... to my children.
The accused was handed .................... a prison sentence of five years.
questions.description: To hand down something is to make a formal decision and give it in writing.
